column4: lol...interesting... Synaptic only sees x86 stuff...how do I add 64-bit capability to my apt?
no, joejaxx, I installed the 32-bit...i was thinking of trying to update on the fly ;)
hey,. it's not the gutsiest (dumbest) move I've ever made
and I'm more than willing to stick with ext3 :-D
haha that was not dumb :P i actually use reiserfs
automaitx is not a really good idea :(
thanks for not botspammin like the other person did....so what's particularly wrong with automatix?

it use scripts and things are not packaged right, it can break your system, you might not see it presently but when you go to update or upgrade to a newer release things are going to break it has happened to alot of people with edgy despite the authors little statement about this channel on the website :(
fun....guess i still gotta go the way I went in Dapper with my last system
yeah probably so
haha yeah me either, i just wish there was a way to educate people about automatix
i do not know as i do not have 64bit pcs well i do but they are old sun sparcstations haha 233mhz
i do not know for sure but i do not think it will
if you are going to try it make sure you install 64bit and then reboot into it
then after a couple of days (or hours or minutes depending on how your system feels ) if everything is stable then remove the 386
did you install the 64bit version of ubuntu?
haha :)
yeah, but reiser's a killer now ;P
lool  :P
but yeah...erm...so I take it doing an on-the-fly upgrade is totally impossible?
i do not know if trying to upgrade from a 32bit version of ubuntu to a 64bit version is going to work at all
haha
